doc.after: As of 2014, Tanzania's gross domestic product (GDP) was an estimated $43.8 billion,[81] or $86.4 billion on a purchasing power parity (PPP) basis.[7] Tanzania is a poor country, with a per capita GDP of $1,813 (PPP),[7] which was 32% below the average of $2,673 for the 45 sub-Saharan African countries[82] and ranked 23rd among those countries.[83]
